security_audit.summary: All static findings are false positives. The skill is a documentation-only project scaffolding tool. Scanner misinterpreted Go import statements as dynamic imports, Cobra CLI framework references as cmd.exe execution, and legitimate configuration URLs and environment variable patterns as security risks. No actual malicious code execution, credential exfiltration, or command injection patterns present.

content.user_title: Set up projects with best practices
content.value_statement: Starting a new project requires careful setup of structure, configuration, and tooling. This skill provides ready-to-use templates for React, Node.js, Python, Go, and other frameworks with complete linting, testing, and CI/CD configuration.
actual_capabilities: Generate project structures for React, Vue, Angular, Next.js, Express, FastAPI, Django, Go, Rust, and other frameworks
Create configuration files for TypeScript, ESLint, Prettier, Jest, Vitest, pytest, and other development tools
Set up environment variable templates with .env.example files for secure configuration management
Configure pre-commit hooks with Husky and lint-staged for automated code quality checks
Initialize Git repositories with appropriate .gitignore files and GitHub Actions workflows
Provide monorepo templates for Turborepo, Nx, and Lerna with shared packages configuration
limitations: This skill generates templates and guidance only. It does not execute shell commands or create files directly on the filesystem
Generated projects require manual review to ensure configuration matches specific project requirements
The skill does not install dependencies or run build commands. Users must execute npm install, pip install, or go mod tidy themselves

best_practices: Always use TypeScript for type safety. It catches errors at compile time and improves code maintainability across the project.
Configure linting and formatting tools from the start. Pre-commit hooks ensure all code meets standards before it is committed.
Separate concerns in your project structure. Keep configuration, models, routes, and services in distinct directories for clarity.
anti_patterns: Do not skip the .gitignore file. Missing entries can commit node_modules, build artifacts, or environment files to version control.
Avoid hardcoding secrets in source code. Always use environment variables with a .env.example template for required configuration.
Do not skip testing setup. Adding tests later is more difficult than starting with a testing framework configured from day one.

faq.question: Does this skill create actual files on my filesystem?
faq.answer: No. This skill provides project templates, code examples, and configuration guidance. You will need to create files manually based on the generated examples.

faq.question: Which frameworks and languages are supported?
faq.answer: The skill supports React, Vue, Angular, Next.js, Node.js (Express, Fastify), Python (Django, FastAPI, Flask), Go, Rust, React Native, Flutter, and monorepo tools like Turborepo and Nx.

faq.question: How do I use the generated templates?
faq.answer: Copy the code examples from the skill output into your project files. The templates include complete file structures, configuration files, and package.json scripts.

faq.question: Can I customize the generated configurations?
faq.answer: Yes. The templates provide sensible defaults but should be reviewed and customized for your specific project requirements, team preferences, and coding standards.

faq.question: Does this skill set up CI/CD pipelines?
faq.answer: The skill includes GitHub Actions workflow examples for continuous integration. You can customize these workflows based on your deployment requirements and hosting platform.

faq.question: How do I add testing to my scaffolded project?
faq.answer: The templates include testing framework setup for each language. React projects use Vitest, Python uses pytest, and Node.js uses Jest. The package.json includes test and test:coverage scripts.
